text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly advises that accepting the \u00a31.4 million settlement is likely the safest strategy, stating, 'If the client has \u2265 12 months of runway or alternative funding, cash urgency is lower.' More critically, under the 'Step-3 - If Hybrid Fails' section, it advises taking the money if the reputational damage is estimated to be \u2264 \u00a3500k. This directly addresses the core concern of the criterion: weighing the certain financial win against the abstract reputation, and implicitly acknowledges the risk that the company may not be solvent enough to pay a judgment if the client walks away to sue, by prioritizing the cash certainty unless the reputational loss is demonstrably higher than the cash offer.", "criterion_id": "ac971de0-8321-435a-92ac-27ae6de6c6b6"}
